context: The concentration of the chlorobenzene gas was confirmed by a commercial chlorobenzene gas detection tube (Gastec). Different amounts of standard chlorobenzene gas were diluted to obtain the desired concentrations with dry air in a second standard vessel (600cm3). Using this standard vessel dilution method, very low concentrations of chlorobenzene (in the ppm range) were obtained. A new glass syringe was used to inject the same volume of chlorobenzene sample into the flow cell. Performance of the sensor device The K+-exchanged glass OWG coated with PTA thin film was exposed to chlorobenzene gas and the absorbance was monitored. These results are presented in Fig. 2 . As shown, when the chlorobenzene gas exists, the absorbance decreases because of adsorption between chlorobenzene gas and PTA film.
